Hello,

Interesting one... this was the most promising thing I found by googling the error: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/openssl/+bug/861137

Indeed I was able to reproduce the problem on ubuntu 11.10 (oneiric). The workaround for curl suggested on that page worked for me: add the option "-sslv3".

Does that work for you? If not more details about your environment would be interesting, though you'll likely be stuck debugging it yourself. :)

Noah

On 2011-12-16 11:02 , ndujiav wrote:
> I've installed heritrix-3.1.0-dist.tar.gz and i want to use the Heritrix 3.0 API .
> when i try to create a new job I get the following error :
>
> $ curl -v -d "createpath=myjob&action=create" -k -u admin:admin --anyauth --location https://localhost:8443/engine
> * About to connect() to localhost port 8443 (#0)
> *   Trying 127.0.0.1... connected
> * Connected to localhost (127.0.0.1) port 8443 (#0)
> * successfully set certificate verify locations:
> *   CAfile: none
>   CApath: /etc/ssl/certs
> * SSLv3, TLS handshake, Client hello (1):
> * SSLv3, TLS alert, Server hello (2):
> * error:14077438:SSL routines:SSL23_GET_SERVER_HELLO:tlsv1 alert internal error
> * Closing connection #0
> curl: (35) error:14077438:SSL routines:SSL23_GET_SERVER_HELLO:tlsv1 alert internal error
>
> Can someone help me, please?
>
>
